Comments_List: This was a very practical and hands on class. I have a much better appreciation for sustainability reporting now
This class was more of an overview than I expected. I would have liked to get a more strategic lens on corporate responsibility.
Exceeded expectations, particularly for a 1/2 term course

Could have a participation grade so that the group projects (which have variable levels of participation/contributions by group members) don't constitute 100% of the final. Need a method to account for this. The final project should have been more of a challenge from a sustainability or corporate responsibility perspective. The winery chosen already was a leader on sustainability, which meant most recommendations related to PR and marketing...
Strengths are the professor and his insights. Weakness is the overview nature of all lectures and readings. Not many in depth discussions on any particular topic.
The two group projects were a bit of whiplash since they were so different. It would have been nice if the final built off of the midterm, since there was essentially no down time between the two
Todd is great and the project-based nature of this class keeps it interesting. Definitely worth taking
